metadata.title: CVE-2021-43531 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When a user loaded a Web Extensions context menu, the Web Extension couldaccess the post-redirect URL of the element clicked. If the Web Extensionlacked the WebRequest permission for the hosts involved in the redirect,this would be a same-origin-violation leaking data the Web Extension shouldhave access to. This was fixed to provide the pre-redirect URL. This isrelated to CVE-2021-43532 but in the context of Web Extensions. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 94.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
